page.title: 10HARVEL VILLAGE HALL
page.content: Harvel Village Hall was built in 1912 and left to the village by Mr F. Cripps -Day on his death.It was extended in 1965 to provide a stage and cloakrooms. The hall is run by a management committee, one member nominated by each of the regular users e.g. the Playgroup, the Cricket Club, the W.I. and the Over Sixties, and 5 elected members. The hall is used also as a surgery, for dancing classes and for private social functions. In the past the hall has been used as a church,Sunday school and for Guides. The committee also administers Swanswood Field now leased to Vigo R.F.C. To raise money for hall upkeep a Fete is organised on each August Bank Holiday.It is run by villagers with no commercial involvement, and the atmosphere remains truly rural.
